pages.title: ⎧ Three of Wands ⎧
pages.text: Spirit of Established Strength$(br)       ☉ Sun in ♈ Aries

A calm, stately person, with their back turned, looking from a cliff's edge at ships leaving to the sea.$(br)  Three staves are planted in the ground, and they lean slightly on one of them.$(br)  Unlike the $(l:patchouli:wands/2)Two of Wands$(), the card is far from balanced. The staves are separated into two and one, giving us an idea of opposition, or of a single person being isolated from a group.$(br)  There are many ways people can find themselves alone and

facing a closed group of other people.$(br)  But the staff by itself facing the other two also can suggest independence, or non-conformity.$(br)  The impulsive approach to life sometimes just burns its way through the world and other aspects can become lost or sacrificed along the way.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Power, independence, divisions between people.$(br)  Explorations, heroic action,
possibly involving sacrifice.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  Cooperation, people working together.
